description:
The Scarlet C-Suite Program is a comprehensive, yearlong program, offered by Career Services. The purpose of the program is to elevate students’ career readiness and success, during and beyond Illinois Tech. It consists of 6 pillars, including 10 professional development workshops, career coaching, volunteer and project experience, finalized career profiles, and a concluding questionnaire.

Students can work at their own pace, completing these courses in one school year, or throughout their time at Illinois Tech. When the program is completed, students will have the skills and competencies to reach their career potential and achieve their dreams.

Required Workshops:
• The Power of Networking & Business Relationships
• Know Your Strengths - Using Your Strengths in the Real World
• What do I say? Communication & Presentation Skills
• Interviewing & Professional Etiquette in the Workplace
• Curiosity & The Power of Asking Questions
• Collaborating & Working Effectively with Diverse Teams (DEI)
• Critical Thinking, Problem Solving & Creativity - Taking Initiative
• Agile & Adaptable- Cultivating a Growth Mindset with Resilience
• Creating a Successful Resume
• Creating a Successful LinkedIn Profile

Search individual workshop for dates/times.

Anything is possible at Illinois Tech!

Disability Resources: If you need assistance with health and wellness services don't hesitate to get in touch with Jirun "Cora" Liu, Assistant Director of Disability Resources. Reasonable accommodations will be made for Illinois Tech students with documented disabilities. Cora can work with you to ensure you get appropriate accommodations to assist you with academic and co-curricular success. Cora can be contacted at disabilities@iit.edu or 312.567.5744.
name: Scarlet C Suite Program Illinois Tech
tagline: Elevating Students’ Career Readiness and Success, During and Beyond Illinois Tech
